options.name: Saboteur
options.description: Gain +1 Engineering and +1 Coordination. You can identify weak points in structures and mechanical devices.

options.name: Structural Weakness
options.description: Your attacks against objects and structures deal double damage. Gain +1 Engineering.

options.name: Quick Sabotage
options.description: You can sabotage a mechanical device as a bonus action. The device will fail or malfunction after 1d4 rounds.

options.name: Mechanical Intuition
options.description: Gain +1 Engineering and the ability to understand the function of technological devices after studying them for 1 minute.

options.name: Action : System Overload
options.description: Target a mechanical or electrical system within touch range. Make an Engineering check to cause it to overload, dealing 2d6 damage to the system and anyone within 5 feet.

options.name: Reaction : Disable Trap
options.description: When you trigger or detect a trap, you can attempt to disable it immediately as a reaction.

options.name: Destabilizing Strikes
options.description: Your attacks can target structural weak points. Once per turn, your weapon attack can deal an additional 1d8 damage to constructs, vehicles, or structures.

options.name: Action : Critical Malfunction
options.description: Target a mechanical device and make an Engineering check. If successful, the device suffers a catastrophic failure that can affect other nearby systems.

options.name: Reverse Engineering
options.description: Gain +1 Engineering. After examining a technological device for 10 minutes, you can create a similar temporary device using scavenged parts.

options.name: Master Saboteur
options.description: Gain +1 Engineering and +1 Coordination. You can identify and exploit critical weaknesses in any system or structure. Your sabotage actions now have triple their normal effect.
